heroIntro: This 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment in La Marina represents a compelling investment opportunity on the Costa Blanca. Priced at €246,000 (€3,154/m²), it sits at a 43% premium to the local La Marina average of €2,200/m², reflecting its premium specification and superior finish quality—yet remains 40% cheaper than comparable properties in Spanish island markets. With the Costa Blanca experiencing consistent 8% year-on-year appreciation, this property positions investors to capitalize on both capital growth and strong rental income. Holiday let demand in La Marina remains robust, with typical weekly rates reaching €800, translating to approximately €41,600 annual gross rental income based on conservative 52-week occupancy. The strategic location, modern finishes, and established tourism infrastructure make this apartment an ideal asset for investors seeking reliable returns and long-term appreciation in one of Spain's most sought-after coastal markets. The 78m² layout maximizes rental appeal while keeping management costs minimal—a key consideration for savvy property investors.
areaSection: La Marina is a vibrant coastal district within Alicante, positioned along the Mediterranean coast with direct access to some of Spain's most desirable beaches. The area experiences a Mediterranean climate with over 300 days of annual sunshine, mild winters (12-15°C), and warm summers (28-32°C). La Marina has evolved into a well-established residential and tourist destination, blending authentic Spanish character with modern infrastructure. The district benefits from continuous investment in urban renewal projects, improved transportation links, and tourism development. Its proximity to Alicante city center (15km) provides urban convenience while maintaining a relaxed coastal atmosphere. The area's popularity stems from reliable sunshine, affordable living compared to northern European standards, and the perfect balance between beach lifestyle and practical amenities.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in La Marina revolves around a mature, cosmopolitan community where English is widely spoken and expats form a significant population segment. The area features excellent restaurants and beach clubs serving international and Spanish cuisine, with weekly markets offering fresh Mediterranean produce. Healthcare is exceptional—regional hospitals with English-speaking staff are within 30 minutes, while private clinics offer immediate access. The established expat infrastructure means English-speaking professionals (lawyers, accountants, estate agents) are readily available, reducing administrative friction for international investors. Shopping is convenient with modern supermarkets (Mercadona, Lidl, Consum) alongside traditional Spanish markets. The blue flag beaches within 20 minutes offer water sports, while nearby championship golf courses attract leisure-focused residents. Public buses connect the area, though car ownership provides optimal flexibility for exploring the broader Costa Blanca region.
investmentSection: This property capitalizes on La Marina's sustained 8% year-on-year appreciation trajectory while offering immediate rental income potential. At €3,154/m², the premium specification justifies the 43% premium over local averages—comparable new-build apartments command higher rental rates and attract quality tourists willing to pay premium weekly rates (€800+). Conservative ROI calculations, assuming 50-week holiday occupancy at €750/week, generate €37,500 annual gross rental income (15.2% gross yield). After accounting for 6% management fees, 15% vacancy buffer, and operating costs (utilities, maintenance, insurance), net yield typically reaches 8-10%—exceeding Spanish mortgage rates and delivering positive cash flow from day one. The Costa Blanca's mature tourism infrastructure, consistent visitor demand, and established short-term rental platforms (Airbnb, Booking.com) minimize vacancy risk. Long-term capital appreciation, combined with reliable rental income, positions this apartment as a dual-return investment vehicle.
conclusion: This €246,000 apartment in La Marina represents a disciplined investment opportunity combining immediate rental income with proven capital appreciation. The premium specification justifies pricing above local averages while remaining 40% cheaper than Spanish island markets. With robust tourism demand, positive cash flow from day one, and consistent 8% year-on-year appreciation, this property delivers dual-return investment performance. healthcare.text: Healthcare access in La Marina is comprehensive and internationally standard. Alicante Regional Hospital Complex, approximately 20 minutes drive, provides full emergency services, specialist departments, and multilingual staff including English-speaking doctors. Private clinics throughout the region offer immediate appointments without NHS waiting times—valuable for international residents and their guests. Pharmacies are abundant (multiple within walking distance), with English-speaking pharmacists common. Healthcare quality consistently ranks among Spain's best, with state-of-the-art equipment and EU-trained professionals. Dental practices, physiotherapy, and specialist services are readily available. For serious emergencies, helicopter evacuation to regional centers takes approximately 30 minutes.

faqs.question: Hvor mye koster denne eiendommen?
faqs.answer: €246,000. This represents €3,154/m² for a premium-specification 2-bedroom apartment. Payment options include cash, Spanish mortgages, and international financing. Legal fees, taxes, and registrations typically add 8-10% to purchase price.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca et godt sted å kjøpe eiendom?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca experiences consistent 8% year-on-year appreciation, established tourism infrastructure, and mature expatriate community. The region offers lower prices than Spanish islands while maintaining Mediterranean lifestyle, excellent healthcare, and reliable rental demand. Investment returns typically exceed mortgage rates.

faqs.question: Kan utlendinger kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Yes. Non-EU citizens can purchase Spanish property without restrictions. UK, US, Canadian, Australian, and other international buyers commonly own property in La Marina. You'll need an NIE (tax identification number), but this is straightforward and obtainable through your legal representative. No visa is required for property purchase.

faqs.question: Hva koster det å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Additional costs typically total 8-10% of purchase price: Transfer Tax (6-10%), Notary Fees (0.3-1%), Registry Fees (0.1%), and Legal Fees (1-2%). No agent commissions apply to buyers in Spain. Always obtain a complete cost breakdown before committing to purchase.

faqs.question: Kan jeg få boliglån i Spania som utlending?
faqs.answer: Yes. Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign nationals with established employment or income verification. Typical terms include 80% loan-to-value ratio, 5-7% interest rates, and 25-30 year amortization. Competitive rates apply when income exceeds €2,500 monthly. Alternative: many investors purchase outright using cross-border financing.

faqs.question: Hva er levekostnadene på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Monthly living costs for one person typically range €800-€1,200 including rent/mortgage, utilities, groceries, and dining. Healthcare is minimal (€100-€200 annually for private coverage). Compared to UK, Australia, and North America, living costs are 30-50% lower. Restaurant meals cost €8-€15, groceries are 40% cheaper than UK prices.

faqs.question: Hvor langt er det fra Norge til Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport, 25 minutes from La Marina, offers 150+ weekly flights to UK destinations (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Glasgow). Flight time is approximately 2.5 hours. Direct flights depart multiple times daily from major UK airports, with budget carriers offering fares from €30-€80 return.

faqs.question: Hvordan er været på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Mediterranean climate with 300+ annual sunshine days. Summers (June-August) reach 28-32°C with minimal rainfall. Winters (December-February) average 12-15°C—mild compared to northern Europe with rare frost. Spring and autumn are ideal (18-24°C). Humidity is moderate; strong summer winds provide natural cooling.

faqs.question: What rental income can I expect from this apartment?
faqs.answer: Conservative estimates suggest €800/week holiday rental rates, generating approximately €37,500-€41,600 annually at 50-52 week occupancy. After 6% management fees, 15% vacancy buffer, and operating costs (€8,000-€10,000 annually), net rental income typically reaches €22,000-€25,000 (8-10% net yield). Actual returns vary based on management quality and seasonal demand.

faqs.question: Is this property suitable for holiday lettings?
faqs.answer: Yes. The 2-bedroom configuration, proximity to beaches, and established La Marina tourism infrastructure make this apartment ideal for holiday rentals. Weekly rates of €750-€850 are achievable through Airbnb, Booking.com, and Vrbo. The compact layout reduces cleaning time and maintenance costs, maximizing profit margins.
